bibl.title: Letter from Sidney Coe Howard to Albert E. Truby, December 19, 1931

div1.p: Howard confirms his appointment with Truby.

div1.head: Letter from Sidney Coe Howard to Albert E. Truby, December 19, 1931
div1.opener:
157 EAST 82ND STREET
NEW YORK CITY
December 19th, 1931.
28th
My dear Colonel Truby:-
div1.p:
Thank you for your prompt reply to
my letter. The days before Christmas seem to be pretty full
in my house. If the 28th is as good for you it is better
for me and, unless I hear from you to the contrary, I shall
come down to Washington on the night of the 27th, telephone
your office on the morning of the 28th and turn up at the
hour you appoint.
div1.closer:
Very Sincerely Yours, Sidney Howard. Albert E. Truby,
Colonel, Medical Corps.
